Wij komen met een zeer gedegen inhoudelijke reactie waar ik van vind dat die probeert zo goed mogelijk – we zullen dat debat met de Kamer voeren en we zullen zeker nog aanvullingen komen  ook vanuit het parlement zonder twijfel – probeert over de volle breedte van het rapport en zelfs breder antwoord te formuleren. Maar mijn persoon en de verkiezingen en of mensen wel of niet op mij moeten stemmen, dat komt in de campagne. Daar ga ik nu niet op antwoorden. VAN DEN BERGH (REUTERS) Namens de internationale media wou ik iets in het Engels vragen, en ik vraag om een Engels antwoord. I would like to know what todays resignation has an impact on the Dutch battle against corona and if you could explain why you felt the need to step down in the midst of this health crisis. RUTTE We felt the need to step down because of the extreme seriousness of the report by the Parliamentary Committee which has studied thoroughly and in-depth what happened. And we came to the conclusion that its unavoidable that we step down. And at the same time that we are still capable – we think with full support of parliament, we respectfully ask for that support, request for that support and we think we will get it of course within the parameters of all the debates and discussions we will have with parliament – to be effective in fighting the corona crisis. SCHREINEMACHERS Mag ik nog één laatste vraag stellen over de gedupeerden? Want die vragen zich misschien af: die 1 mei, is dat een streven of is dat een harde belofte? En zo ja, wie kunnen we daar op afrekenen? RUTTE Nou, dit is in ieder geval onze heilige plicht om dit zo goed mogelijk te realiseren. Maar ik wil nu in een dossier waar in zoveel dingen niet goed zijn gegaan, hier niet vandaag een harde belofte doen waarvan we niet in alle gevallen duizend procent zeker ook weten of je die kan halen. Maar alles, alles, alles is erop gericht dat iedereen die zich voor 15 februari heeft gemeld, dat die voor 1 mei die 30.000 euro heeft.
topics_EN: Literal Text Press Conference after Council of Ministers January 15, 2021
speeches_EN: Good afternoon. One of my distant predecessors such as Prime Minister, Pieter Cort van der Linden, once wrote about the task of the government: "The state dries back the recovery, protects the weak, distributes the risks, and is in the hasty compulsion to all as a guide and it is clear that the government has not satisfied with that standard. The rule of law must protect citizens against an almighty government and that went wrong here in a terrible way. The report of the parliamentary interrogation committee for childcare allowance is hard, but Fair. At all levels, throughout the political-administrative-legal system, mistakes have been made that led to thousands of parents being in great injustice. But the political responsibility ultimately lies with the sitting cabinet and nowhere else. In recent weeks and days we have discussed the report a number of times within the cabinet. With the most important goal of drawing up a thorough substantive response to the report. A reaction that is aimed at that something like that can never happen in this way. We completed that reaction today and we will offer the Lower House in accordance with agreement today. The parents are entitled to that. The cabinet response is of course about financial compensation to the affected parents - that is now the first to be properly arranged. And we will continue with that anyway. But of course more is needed for the future. Because it cannot and should not go so terribly wrong again. That is why there must be a whole new allowance system, starting with the childcare allowance. Signals that things are not going well somewhere must come up much faster and lead to action much faster. And the information provision must also be fundamentally overhauled. For example, from now on the documents that underlie a cabinet decision will be made public and a decision list with explanation will be published after each Council of Ministers. Today the question of political responsibility was also discussed. We are united: if the entire system has failed, responsibility can only be given jointly. And that has led to the conclusion that I have just offered the king the dismissal of the entire cabinet. And I will go to the palace in conclusion to this press conference to explain the king. And with that the cabinet has become outgoing. As a former State Secretary for Finance, Eric Wiebes has made the personal assessment that he will not go through a outgoing way and immediately resigns as Minister of Economic Affairs and Climate. He will explain this decision himself. It is his decision that I respect. With his creative mind, Eric Wiebes has often contributed to solving complex issues. We're going to miss him. The question now is: what does the cabinet resign in concrete terms? The elections are planned for mid -March. And in the meantime we can be expected to do what is needed in the national interest. Of course we do this in close consultation with and accounting to the parliament. I want to say to the Netherlands: our fight against the Coronavirus continues. In the coming months, our work will be dominated by Corona and the absorption of the economic and social consequences through all existing and announced support packages. And to the affected parents in the affair around the childcare allowance, I want to say this: we will continue to work rapid compensation and the improvements needed for the future. With this decision of today, the government wants to do justice to all those parents to whom unprecedented injustice is affected. Thank you. Schreinemachers (RTL News) Mr. Rutte, you say "something is terrible, going wrong in a terrible way." Couldn't not have been prevented if the cabinet had been open and transparent about the mistakes made earlier? Rutte Sorry. Schreinemachers You said "something went wrong in a terrible way," but in the past, even when the room asked questions about it, it is often not open and transparently told what had happened. Could not have been prevented if the cabinet had been open and transparent earlier? Rutte okay, I understand the question. There is a lot to be said about that, we will also in the cabinet response, we will discuss that and also in answering the many questions that the House of Representatives has asked. And what we determine anyway is that when it comes to the provision of information to the room, but also to you as journalists, we want to change things fundamentally. I have announced that list of decisions of the Council of Ministers with explanation, but also that we will share all considerations, all documents that underlie this, with decisions of the government or legislation. And we will also delete the exception that the WOB now knows about personal policy views of officials. Schreinemachers then there is a very concrete question. Many victims wonder: what do we have about this, we have often promised that we will be compensated quickly and generously. What can be concrete now that you will do now that you have fallen? Rutte I sat on the phone for a long time with one of the affected parents, Samantha. And she was very concerned by the departure of Lodewijk Asscher and also the reports that the cabinet might become outgoing: what does that mean for me? I assured her that the cabinet, but I am convinced that the House of Representatives will support us in this, there are two priorities for the coming months. And that is of course Corona, but also the settlement of this terrible issue. And that means that we want to compensate as quickly as possible. Of course we have already taken decisions about this during the Christmas period, by ensuring that the parents who have been duped by the hard, all-or-nothing explanation of the law or by excessive fraud yacht are paid 30,000 euros. And all the other actions that have been taken and started, we will continue with that. So I really want to say to the parents: becoming this outgoing, this resignation of the cabinet, has no consequences for you. I am convinced that the Chamber will support us to do everything to quickly shape that compensation, but also to initiate all the actions to prevent recurrence. Schreinemachers yes. You also said that the cabinet came to the conclusion that resignation was the only option. Was that indeed united, were you also convinced that this was the only logical conclusion after that rock -hard report? Rutte yes we are completely unanimous in that, because you saw in recent weeks that of course we saw there if you are there ... not in the cabinet as a whole, because we only talked about it procedurally, but within parties and between ministers as it was spoken, there was of course always the great care: what happens if your demissionary is a child's reception of the Demonvisage committee, , there is no doubt about that, with no one - but the care was "what does that mean for Corona's approach?". And the awareness has also grown in the last few days, also through signals - today again I also saw a tweet from the leader of GroenLinks, Jesse Klaver, but also from other parties - that of course the room will not just follow everything the cabinet does, but realizes, wider than just the coalition that is necessary with the factor of the area of ​​the cabinet and the cabinet of the area of ​​the area of ​​the area of ​​the area of ​​the area of ​​the area of ​​the area of ​​the kanision and the Kanission and the Kanission and the Kanission and the Kanission and the Kanission and the Kanission and the Kanission and the Kanission and the Kanission and the Kanission and the Kanission and the Kansional and the Kansional and the Kansional Fight. That was incredibly important. And when we came to the conclusion that both can, namely ... Schreinemachers ... of symbolic value that the cabinet will resign ... Rutte sorry, I finish it for a moment. So when we came to the conclusion that both can, so both do justice to the report and the suffering of the parents by taking our political responsibility, but also the corona fighting mentally and in deeds fully as a normal cabinet, naturally respectfully to the room to give us that space, but I have said the only step that we can take today. Schreinemachers does not have a great symbolic value if the cabinet is left now, but in the meantime things will continue and see the people in a few days that you are busy with Corona again and little changes in practice? Rutte no. The cabinet is declining, thereby taking full responsibility for what has gone wrong and for the violation of the rule of law. Voting (NOS Journaal) Mr. Rutte, the colleague of RTL also says: the suffering that these parents has been affected has been known for much longer, now you are just leaving just before the elections, what is this actually more than a symbolic step of the cabinet? Rutte Before Christmas, the report of the parliamentary interrogation committee was published about the childcare allowance. That is a very fierce report that fulfills us all with great shame. We discussed that report in the cabinet, we first want to provide a substantive response. Today it goes to the room, 25 pages thick: on all fronts we try to indicate everything as well as possible to prevent something like that being able to repeat again. But there is also a political question and it is not symbolic. It is fierce what happened. The rule of law that also includes that you and I are being protected against the government's omnipotence, which has failed here. People ended up between the wheels of that rule of law. And then the answer is, we think, that we as a cabinet also take responsibility and resign collectively. Voting and what will the parents benefit from that? Rutte This is politically important. What the parents need to know is that it has no consequences, that is the first. That is a concern for some of the parents. That it has no consequences for setting up all the financial consequences that arise for individual parents as quickly as possible. We work hard on that. This will not mean a delay in that. Our ambition is just as hard by working as we did before Christmas. And in terms of content, I am convinced that we, but of course we will talk to the Chamber respectfully, will be given the space of parliament to take all the measures needed now to prevent something like that in the future. Voting but you just say "I want to make sure that those parents get their compensation faster". Take the thirty thousand euros, for example. That is promised before Christmas, but it will take until May, if it all goes well before those parents have that. What is the reason for thinking that it will go faster than so far? Rutte that is the planning we have. That is a huge operation, in which we are committed to the fact that all the victims who have reported before 15 February of this year to surcharges, will receive those thirty thousand euros before 1 May. And that is a first pay. They never have to repay that amount either. And if parents are entitled to more, then of course they will get that too. Voting alone, that can still take a long time? Rutte It is not that we have made decisions today that lead to it being faster. This is a huge operation. But the decision that we have made before Christmas, even after the report was published, it is now necessary to accelerate to offer all parents that perspective that concerns that thirty thousand euros and then to work very hard on the rest of the reimbursement, with all the complexity that goes with it. For example, to prevent everything going to debt repayment, that parents are still in major problems afterwards. That parents can also rebuild their lives. We also do this together with municipalities, with all kinds of other organizations. That is a lot of work. We work very hard and quickly on that. But what we are doing priority now, and this decision is not changing today, and parents who are concerned that it does not have to be afraid of that, we will continue to work on that thirty thousand euros that we want to pay for before 1 May. Voting but still, for some of the parents, the thirty thousand euros - it sounds a lot when you hear such an amount - but for some of the parents, half I have heard the State Secretary estimate, it is not nearly enough. Those people now have to ... do you really think it is all to give those people within a reasonable period of time, for example this year, all their money. Rutte precisely because we noticed that ... look, the point is, if you were to pay everyone out exactly what they are entitled to and you would do that without having arranged all the other things properly, then you run the risk that a lot of people immediately spend that money paying off the debts that are still open and still have a lot of debts. So one of the things we are working on is to ensure that people also have perspective to rebuild their lives as debts as possible. That's one thing. The second thing is that you want to prevent people from having to wait too long. And that is why we said before Christmas "We now want to decide, immediately, until that benefit, at the latest at the latest, of the thirty thousand euros for anyone who reported to us on 15 February. Voting Lodewijk Asscher - I still want to ask a few things, Sorry - Lodewijk Asscher has left the Labor Party, has resigned. Mr. Wiebes is also leaving. Why do you think you can continue? Because you will resign, but we will immediately see you again as the leader of the VVD. Rutte I naturally have all the respect for the decision Eric has made and he will immediately explain it himself. And what I have done, what the cabinet has done, as a Collective Cabinet is now offering us resignation to the king. That is of course a far -reaching constitutional step. Voting but you personally, why do you think you can continue as a party leader? Rutte ultimately is whether I can pass the party as a party leader. I have no doubt about that. And it is up to the voter to finally decide in the elections how many seats get which party. But I think this is the step that must now be taken by the cabinet. Voting and you personally, what will you change? Because this all happened in the ten years that you are prime minister of this country. One of the criticisms is a huge lack of openness to the room or to journalists. What will you personally change to tackle that? Rutte will also see you in the response that we have spoken very extensively about that information provision. The current legislation leaves room, which I always find important that civil servants can also discuss among themselves to do that, but we are now making a few far -reaching decisions. That is that we want to make it directly to the Council of Ministers which decisions plus explanation ... but that applies to me. I give an implementation to that. That if we make decisions, send notes or if we make laws, that we will also distribute all the underlying documents that are important. That the grounds for exception that the WOB now offers, the Government Government Government Act, namely the personal policy views, that we will delete them. And that means that in that respect there is much more openness, where we want to talk to the room to ensure that civil servants must be protected in order to be able to have some discussion with each other without that leading to very crazy images in the outside world. Voting do you find that you have not only made politics but also personal mistakes in this? Rutte I have always implemented the legislation, but I note that this leads to a lot of irritation with you as journalists, also in the Lower House, so I fully support this step and I also find it very suitable in response to the report that is now. Finally, voting: Corona, it also turned out last week that many people are also worried about a cabinet that resigns on something very serious, but also in a period that, you have already called it the great crisis after the Second World War. Is it really justified to do this? Rutte yes, I am now convinced. I have been worried about whether a retiring cabinet is able to do everything that is needed to combat such a serious pandemic. Of course I also said something about that at the press conference last Tuesday. But I also saw the reaction from circles of, for example, GroenLinks, Labor Party, and I came to the conclusion: we all came to the conclusion that we can both do. Namely: and effectively leading the coronacrisis, that will of course go in close consultation with the House of Representatives. But I am convinced that we can continue to do so effectively. And that at the same time - at the same time - there was no doubt about that - that the government's resignation is discussed with such a serious report anyway. But that that was possible without this being damaged to that Corona Bidding. But also does damage, I think, to giving follow -up to the report of the parliamentary interrogation committee. Voting and you are not afraid that ... you might have to make a decision about something controversial as a curfew in the Netherlands in the coming days. That you are now outgoing, does it have less authority to do that? Rutte no, no, and that is also the Netherlands. And those are also the reactions we have received from the circles of GroenLinks, PvdA, in which we also convinced other political parties, that everyone can see that you can fight endlessly with each other about political views, ideas, legislation, etc. But that if there is such a big crisis that touches our public health. Namely the coronac crisis. That we are shoulder to shoulder. That does not mean that there is no criticism. If there is criticism of parts of the policy, that is fine. That is why we have debates every two weeks. But what I have always seen in the last ten months in which this crisis is now raging is that a large majority of the room - much broader than just the coalition - says: after that criticism has been discussed, after answers have come after we may not agree on everything. That we unanimously fight that coronacrisis. And in the last few days, in the past week, I have received many signals that confirm that to me. Which means that I also have the confidence, and we as a cabinet have the confidence that you can both do. Entering the report, but also remain effective in combating the coronac crisis. Nijs (Hart van Nederland) Mr. Rutte, have you considered stepping up, also as a VVD freight tractor? Rutte I didn't consider that myself. Because I think that's ultimately the voter. Because I have no direct involvement in this file. But of course I am indirectly responsible for everything that goes well in the cabinet. And in the first place what is not going well. Nijs You don't think you were directly involved in this affair in the last ten years? Rutte well with this whole issue, of course, the cabinet widely only came into the picture in the summer of last year. Then we gave the severity of what has been called: hardness system. That people had to repay everything in the event of small mistakes, that enormous impact has become clear to us from summer last year. Of course I am ultimately responsible as a foreman of the cabinet for everything that goes well and not well. And in the first place for what is not going well. But no direct responsibility for this file. So I think I can continue as a freight. But that is ultimately up to the voter to judge it. Nijs You have been involved more directly in it for a while. A year ago in Rijswijk there was another session with many victims too. How do you look back on that a year further? Rutte that session was impressive. But your question was of course: how do you appraise that politically? And I can only tell you what my conclusion is, that I continue as a party leader because I naturally feel responsible for everything the cabinet does. Do not have a direct responsibility for this file. That is just the case. I am prime minister. I am not on one of the departments. But of course feels very involved with that and also wants to do everything to make it a success in the settlement and I also feel fulfilled of shame for what went wrong. Nijs yes, I actually wondered now in a year ago that you also spoke to the parents, do you have the idea ... How do you look back on that? A year further? Rutte that was a very impressive conversation. After that, of course, the cabinet started setting up the enormous compensation that must take place. We said of this: that is incredibly complex because you want to prevent people from immediately spend the money on the debts they still have. That went so complicated, and that demand so much manpower, that we have now decided before Christmas to make that acceleration by at least giving parents the perspective on that 30,000 euros. Aharouay (NRC) Mr. Rutte, the cabinet has taken a month to - we always heard - to be able to respond to that report in terms of content. We now hear some of the measures that have been taken. I don't hear anything about the still systemic discrimination that took place in the allowance affair. Has it been on the table at all? Rutte certainly. You will also see of this in the reaction that we bring out, that we will elaborate on that. Aharouay maybe you can tell something about it now. Rutte yes, to begin with of course that it is unacceptable when it happens. That discrimination is totally reprehensible if that happens and especially if signals were to the government. The fact that of course at different places is currently being looked at, for example the Dutch Data Protection Authority that stated last year that the Tax Authorities went into the error with the storage of and processing the second nationality in risk selection models. And there were also apologies made by State Secretary Van Huffelen on behalf of the cabinet. Measures have been taken to prevent it from going wrong again. Parents who appear to be discrimination are eligible for compensation and also any additional compensation. And there is an investigation into the fraud signaling facility at the Tax Authorities, the issue that also emerged a while ago, a system in which signals of fraud were noted. And we set up a state committee in the government's response, discrimination and racism, to prevent terrible things like this in the future. Aharouay yes you now read it a bit dry, maybe as a prime minister, but certainly also as a VVD party leader, you also think that you could take it for so long. Rutte certainly, I just told you. I think it is terrible if the government is guilty of discrimination or whatever, which is contrary to the fundamental rights that we as people have and the foundations of our rule of law. And that is why it is so important. And the dry list are important measures because you ultimately have evocative statements what you want and do not want to come to policy to ensure that it cannot repeat themselves and that people who are touched by it are also compensated. Aharouay yes. The cabinet is now taking responsibility, Herman Tjeenk Willink wrote this week: the room should also look at itself, is the legislative side. What do you actually think of that? Rutte but the legislator we are together, the cabinet and room together. And we now have the reaction on behalf of the cabinet and ultimately: The Buck Stops here. In the end, the government is of course always the one who has to draw the final political consequences and we do that today. And any reflection on the part of parliament, I will not be about that. Aharouay just about Corona, because Wiebes gets up. Is this also the moment that a Rescuffle can take place in the cabinet? Has it been discussed? Rutte no. We will no longer do that so early before the elections. What we do is that for the coming days Formal Cora van Nieuwenhuizen observes the portfolio, because there must be someone at the Ministry of Economic Affairs and the VVD will nominate someone for the vacancy as soon as possible. Aharouay so there will be anyone else who is going to replace Wiebes in the outgoing cabinet? Rutte There will be a replacement for Eric Wiebes, that cannot be done for Cora long. That is two too heavy portfolios together. Ahharouay finally, last question. You already indicated a few times that you want to continue as a VVD party leader. We hear from parents: we have still not given that second chance. Ardy was just talking about it: that 30,000 euros has not been paid to anyone. You explicitly ask for a second chance or actually a fourth chance, because it would be a fourth cabinet. Can you explain why you earn it, while those parents have not actually been given the space for it? Rutte or I earn it determines the voter on March 17. I can only make myself available and I make myself available as a party leader, knowing that something has gone terribly wrong. In the end it is always my final responsibility. I am a foreman of the coalition, so I am prime minister if things go very wrong in the Netherlands, that is of course always my responsibility, always my responsibility. There is no doubt about that. And of course you always have to ask yourself: what does that mean? I am convinced that it is important to give this implementation now, both the coronacrisis and giving follow -up to that report of the parliamentary interrogation committee. I am available again as a party leader of my party and it is of course up to the voter on March 17 to find something of it. Hendrickx (de Volkskrant) ... for that interrogation committee is actually always said: those underlying documents, prior to decision -making, we cannot bring them out because then we cannot make wise decisions as you say. How is it possible that it is suddenly possible? Isn't that very strange? Rutte well we will therefore have to look for roads, together with the room, that if you make much more public than we did, so if you also make all the underlying documents publicly publicly coming out as a bill or a large cabinet note, if you offer the deviation of deviation, so the possibility that the WOB offers to do with personal policy opposes that we have to say, that is what we will make, that that decision - ensure that we keep everyone whole? That we are not all pointing: what kind of proposal did it do? But we think, because there is so much irritation, I have noticed for some time, among journalists, at the House of Representatives, about the fact that, for example, those personal policy views are kept secret, the fact that the government does not proactively bring out everything that has been for a proposal, I think we have to take this radical step now. Hendrickx, but with that you actually say, your estimate so far "it is not possible," was wrong? Rutte well, I notice that the irritation is there. My thinking is of course also shifted, even on the basis of all the conversations you have about it, where we say in the reaction: you have to look together, how do you ensure that you keep the whole whole? So that you do not damage civil servants. That is of course terribly important. And I think that is possible. So we will use that search together. But we have also decided radically that exception of personal policy views, to delete them. Hendrickx, but we don't just get many more informal proposals, as you can see during the coalition consultation on Monday, that a bit of a fixed generation has become? Rutte no. I also wondered, I don't think so. And the interesting experiment was when Louis Asscher asked a while ago to get all those slide texts from the Catshuis. Then we said: yes, but we often did not discuss those documents at all and why do we have to provide that because then there is no explanation at all? But we started to do that. And that actually worked fine, you know. So there too my thinking has shifted that if you just provide all that information, people can also handle it. Hendrickx so you actually say, because your own officials spoke about the Rutte doctrine, who was wrong? Rutte Well, what has been mentioned there is not a term of me, but that is what I assume - in that context of that one text message to me from an official of General Affairs - that exceptional grounds that the Public Access Act offers not to provide personal policy views of civil servants. I think we should take this big step now, that is a very big step. And at the same time the joint search is to ensure that you do not damage civil servants. Lenton (De Telegraaf) yes Mr. Rutte, you say: I am confident that a outgoing cabinet can just as well fight the Coronacrisis as a missionary cabinet. Can you also guarantee that? Rutte no. I can't guarantee anything, that's not possible. We live in a democracy. A missionary cabinet can never automatically count on majorities. But I notice when it comes to this huge pandemic and this great public health threat that everyone realizes that in the end politics has two tasks: to ensure that you and I are safe and to ensure that there is an economy that leads to Enough jobs. And that first point, this touches on: our personal safety, our public health. And I notice, also in recent days and weeks and in all responses also from other parties, that this is felt broad. So I have that trust, but you can never give guarantees on it because ultimately - even with a missionary cabinet - you have to form a majorities. Lengton can you explain to people what the difference is between the way in which the missionary cabinet deals with Corona and soon outgoing? Rutte Corona no difference as far as I'm concerned. No difference in Corona and I do not hope for settling the childcare allowance scandal. I hope we will find the support of the room. We will respectfully ask that we will find the support of the House of Representatives. I actually trust that too. We will of course investigate that in the coming days and in Corona that is actually already said in public expressions from GroenLinks and Labor Party. But I suspect that if we discuss that well in a debate or when that is, and also for the childcare allowance, from the very terrible report, I suspect that we are de facto missionary on those two points. Lengton, which of course is also a difference is that Mr. Wiebes will not be there later. Now he was in the middle of building a new support package for entrepreneurs. Can that be endangered? A bowl with knowledge in that area will at least go away. Rutte yes there is a bowl of knowledge and a bowl of creativity and ingenuity. It's a unique man. Has contributed a lot to the successful tinkering of those packages that are widely seen in Europe as a lot of successful. Of course not only, he did that with Wopke Hoekstra, with Wouter Koolmees, but also with the three state secretaries; Mona Keijzer, Hans Vijlbrief and Bas van 't Wout. But we will definitely miss him in that. So an expensive duty for my party to ensure that that vacancy is filled properly. He didn't have left Lengton from you? He had not removed Rutte No from me, but I respect his decision. He feels this way. He says "I was State Secretary at the time, but he will explain it further, it is his decision. Lemsom (EenVandaag) yes Mr. Rutte, you just said "I had no direct involvement in this file. But is it not so ... Can you not conclude afterwards that you did not take enough direction, because otherwise this would not have dragged on for that long? Rutte if something goes wrong, it is always my responsibility and certainly when it comes to a foreman of the coalition. But I have not been a minister on finance or social affairs in recent years, so in that sense it is indirect, but I am not running away from my responsibility. I have always said: if things go well in the cabinet, then it should ray on the ministers. And if things are not going well, you must address me. Lemsom we just talked about the Rutte doctrine and perhaps the lack of brightness and transparency from the government. It is of course not for nothing that the Rutte doctrine is called. Perhaps that has also been your administrative style in recent years. Did that not contribute to how long this file has dragged on? Rutte no I don't believe that. That term appears once in the file once in an SMS of a civil servant following a report to me about a coalition consultation that I was not there. And from that context I get that this means: the existing ground for exception in the Government Information (Public Access) Act not to have to provide personal policy views of policy officials in completeness. We have now decided to take a big step there. Lemsom But if you think something should be changed about that, then you will also find that that did not go well enough. Then that was your way of working in recent years. Rutte but it is not that I came up with that. That is the law. And what I only determine is that it leads - that whole approach - to a lot of irritation among MPs, with journalists and that also in recent months my thinking has moved to "we will have to do it radically differently". But searching, together with the House of Representatives, that is the search in the coming weeks and months, to prevent us from damaging officials, because that is not allowed. Lemsom finally: the elections are almost coming, you will continue as the VVD leader, then for the average voter the image 'The cabinet is now falling, but those elections were already there, then you will continue And nothing has actually changed '. Rutte De Voter decides what the House of Representatives looks like after the elections. I don't determine that. And otherwise this is a major constitutional step. The entire cabinet is resigning today. That is really a big step. And it is not for nothing that there has been a hesitation with some to do that. Not because the report would not be heavy enough for that, but also because of the coronacrisis. And we gradually come to the conclusion in the cabinet that both can go hand in hand: and take this responsibility and resign, but also remain effective on the Corona Bidding. Lemsom because earlier you said about the possible resignation of the cabinet "we have to wonder if we would have done it if there would have been no elections within a few months. Had you done it too? Rutte yes I think this report is so heavy that it should of course be the case without elections. It cannot be that because of the elections or not. But of course you have to ask that question. But I think that everyone involved in this issue says: this is so serious, apart from elections, requires this resignation from the cabinet. Healthcare was on the effectiveness of the Corona Bidding and there the conviction has grown that you can both do it. Markus (Trouw) Mr. Rutte, you are now resigning. Had the constitutional law not been purer if you had waited for the debate of next Tuesday? Rutte It is a report issued by a committee of the House of Representatives. It is not an external report or something that pops up in the media. It is a report written by a committee of the House of Representatives to which the cabinet responds. What is extremely serious, what all of us fulfills with shame, I just said, which shows that the rule of law has failed on a number of fundamental points. Then I think that the cabinet itself can draw this conclusion and ultimately that is also our constitutional position: that we must say that we are ultimately responsible for what happens in the political company, that we take this conclusion. Markus you previously told NRC Handelsblad that you had to think if this is a blemish on your premiership. Have you thought about that in the meantime? Rutte yes, but just that the inheritance is no doubt about it that it is a blemish on my premiership. Where I had my doubts is that it suddenly went over me. So the question that was asked me by the NRC and when I lashed him back I thought yes, that's a clumsy answer from your Rutte. Because then it's just like I'm not finding it. I think it's a huge blemish. But I wanted to prevent it from suddenly that Mark Rutte was pathetic because he had a blemish on his premiership. And there I made a mistake in my answer. No doubt that this is a colossal blemish. But again: it's not about me or my grief. This is about tens of thousands of parents who have ended up between the wheels of the state. Bhikhie (nu.nl) Prime Minister Rutte, I still want to go to the core of this problem. And that is that the government has no longer started to see citizens as citizens, but as data. Will something change about the risks, selection models, the way in which the Tax Authorities work. Use of second nationalities, racism, discrimination and algorithms. Does the government stop that? Rutte what I just said: we will all tackle that. We will all review that. Also see where that is not going well in other places. Because it should never be the case that you or I think that on the basis of nationality or race or whatever, we or sexual orientation, that we are discriminated against in any way. That is absolutely unacceptable in a rule of law. Also for nothing that we set this state committee on this point. And then you have to look very carefully what exactly happened. The Dutch Data Protection Authority has of course said things about this, and we will ensure that we apply all those lessons and prevent it from happening. It should not happen anymore. Bhikhie but I can hope that in those four weeks in which you said you would come to an answer to this question, about risk models and algorithms in general .... Rutte yes, the point is. The point is that we initially focused on the report of the parliamentary interrogation committee and that did not have this in the assignment. So we said to each other at some point: we have to take this into account ourselves in the reaction. You will also see in the cabinet response that we will discuss this in detail. Even though that has not been a subject that the POK looked at. We have decided to do that anyway. That is not the final answer. That also applies to this entire letter. That is a very far -reaching letter in which we on: how do you ensure that things like this can no longer happen, that what goes wrong in implementation is always known as quickly as possible at the highest levels so that you can make adjustments. That you and I feel heard as a citizen when we report to the government, and not as number. That racism and discrimination cannot prevent. We do now on all those points, we draw far -reaching conclusions. But not everything is completely finished. And certainly when it comes to this issue, it will have to be studied further. Bhikhie last question ... Rutte but the ambition is clear. This should not happen. Bhikhie last question then: You have already answered several questions. That you want to continue. Why should the Netherlands have to trust you ... You have ten years you are already prime minister. This happened under your regime. Why should the Netherlands be confident that the rule of law is still in good hands with you? Rutte look at the reaction we are now giving. But I'm not going to keep a campaign story here for the VVD for myself. I am here as prime minister of this cabinet. I think that the cabinet right today has drawn the only conceivable conclusion when we came to the conclusion that the Corona Bidding would not lead to it. The only justified conclusion has drawn: namely to offer his resignation collectively. We come up with a very thorough substantive response that I think is trying as well as possible - we will have that debate with the Chamber and we will certainly also come additions from parliament - tries over the full width of the report and even formulate a wider answer. But my person and the elections and whether or not people should vote for me, that is in the campaign. I'm not going to answer that now. Van den Bergh (Reuters) On behalf of the international media I wanted to ask something in English, and I ask for an English answer. I would like to know what today has an impact on the Dutch battle against Corona and if you could explain why you felt the need to step down in the midst of this health crisis. Rutte we felt the need to step down because of the extreme seriousness of the report by the parliamentary committee which has studied thoroughly and in-depth what happened. And we come to the conclusion that its unavoidable that we step down. And at the same time that we are still capable - we think with full support of parliament, we respectful ask for that support, request for that support and we think we will get it of course within the parameters of all the debates and discussions we will Have with parliament - to be effective in Fighting the Corona Crisis. Kreinemachers can I ask one last question about the victims? Because they may wonder: that May 1, is that a goal or is that a hard promise? And if so, who can we pay for it? Rutte Well, this is in any case our holy duty to achieve this as well as possible. But now I want to make a hard promise here in a file where so many things have not gone well today, of which we are not in all cases for sure if you can get it. But everything, everything, everything is aimed at it that everyone who reported before 15 February has that before 1 May that 30,000 euros.

topics_nl: Letterlijke tekst persconferentie na ministerraad 8 januari 2021
speeches_nl: Ja, goeiedag allemaal. En ik weet niet of het nog mag, de beste wensen, volgens mij ben ik een dag te laat, maar toch zeer welgemeend zie ik ook uit naar onze samenwerking in het nieuwe jaar en hoop ik dat het voor jullie een goed jaar is, zowel professioneel als qua gezondheid vooral. Paar punten van mijn kant ter inleiding. Om te beginnen wil ik kort iets zeggen over de situatie in de Verenigde Staten. We hebben daar natuurlijk de beelden gezien van de bestorming van het Capitool in Washington. Er is internationaal natuurlijk heel veel over gezegd, er was veel kritiek op wat we allemaal live hebben kunnen volgen. Ik denk dat het ontzettend belangrijk is dat parlementariërs altijd zowel veilig alsook onafhankelijk hun werk kunnen doen. En dus had dit niet mogen gebeuren. Gelukkig blijkt het democratische proces in de VS onstuitbaar en zijn zowel de verkiezingsuitslag als daarmee ook de overwinning van Joe Biden bevestigd en daarmee ook officieel vastgesteld. We zien allemaal uit naar de inauguratie op 20 januari van de nieuwe president. Ook de samenwerking. Nederland en de Verenigde Staten zijn hechte bondgenoten en zeker ook met het vertrek van het Verenigd Koninkrijk uit de Europese Unie wacht ons naar mijn overtuiging een bijzondere rol als misschien wel het meest trans-Atlantische land van die Europese Unie, zonder het Verenigd Koninkrijk, en dus ook een bijzondere rol in de samenwerking met Amerika: Het land dat ons bevrijd heeft in de Tweede Wereldoorlog met anderen. Dan was vandaag na de twee eerdere bijeenkomsten op het Catshuis, de eerste keer dat we met het hele kabinet echt inhoudelijk hebben gesproken over de bevindingen van de commissie Van Dam over de toeslagen, de kinderopvangtoeslag. We hebben daar eerder over gesproken, vlak voor het kerstreces. De verschrikkelijke feiten, de schaamte, die ons allemaal bekruipt bij het lezen van het rapport van die parlementaire onderzoekscommissie. We kijken nu naar de belangrijkste inhoudelijke vraag: namelijk hoe kunnen we zorgen dat zoiets in de toekomst niet meer kan gebeuren? Maar uiteraard praten we daarbij ook over de opgeworpen vragen waar betreft de rechtsstaat, informatievoorziening. Dat allemaal vereist een buitengewoon duidelijk antwoord van het kabinet. Dat komt zo snel mogelijk, we moeten wel zorgvuldig doen. We werken aan die kabinetsreactie en zo nodig zullen we daar volgende week ook weer nader over spreken. Dan kort iets over het vaccineren. Dat is deze week begonnen in Nederland. Dat is natuurlijk een heuglijk moment. Elke Nederlander die beschermd is tegen het virus, is een stap vooruit. De ontwikkelingen op het gebied van vaccinaties volgen elkaar in ijltempo op. En vandaag natuurlijk het goede nieuws over de extra order die geplaatst is en is toegezegd door Pfizer en daarnaast natuurlijk de hopelijk snelle goedkeuring van het vaccin van Astra-Zeneca. Maar dat betekent niet, wil ik hierbij nog wel eens zeggen, dat we van de ene op de andere dag van het virus verlost zijn. Het duurt echt enige tijd. Het is voor de mensen individueel van heel groot belang dat ze het vaccin natuurlijk hebben, maar voor het land als geheel geldt dat het echt een tijd duurt voordat we het ook collectief met elkaar gaan merken. Je ziet helaas hier, maar ook in andere landen, in Duitsland stijgt het nu naar recordcijfers. In Engeland, maar ook in Nederland. Geen recordcijfers, maar wel te hoge besmettingscijfers. Het blijft ook druk, te druk, in de ziekenhuizen en op de intensive-careafdelingen. Terwijl het van belang is, niet zozeer dat wil dus zeggen dat we de zorg willen ontlasten – die zorg zit helemaal niet te wachten op minder werk – die zorg wil alleen vooral kunnen werken voor de mensen die naast corona ook naar het ziekenhuis komen, omdat ze met ernstige klachten te maken hebben, bijvoorbeeld kanker of hartoperaties en willen die operaties niet hoeven uit te stellen. Daarom is het zo belangrijk dat we die druk van corona op de gezondheidszorg kunnen verlagen. Dan hebben we ook nog te maken met de Britse variant, waarvan ook in de landen om ons heen zien dat dat ook daar geïntroduceerd is. Dat maakt het beeld er ook niet rustiger op. Er zijn dus voorlopig, de komende tijd, hoe hard we ook werken aan vaccinatie, nog te weinig gevaccineerde mensen om ons op die manier uit de problemen te helpen. Dus het blijft van zeer groot belang dat we allemaal de coronaregels heel goed naleven. En dat geldt overigens ook als je gevaccineerd bent. En uiteraard is er wel licht aan het einde van de tunnel, laten we dat wel met elkaar vaststellen. Het goede nieuws is wel dat we nu perspectief hebben, later dit jaar, dat we misschien eindelijk van die ellende af zijn. Niettemin: de cijfers nog steeds hoog. Dat betekent dat ook het Outbreak Management Team ons zal adviseren de komende dagen over wat zij vinden dat we zouden moeten doen. Daar gaan we dan ook over praten zondag weer in het Catshuis in de bekende samenstelling en dan dinsdag in de ministeriële commissie. Dat betekent dat er ook voorzien is een persconferentie weer aanstaande dinsdag. En hoe we dan verder gaan na 19 januari. Nogmaals, dat zal een weloverwogen besluit zijn op basis van het advies van het Outbreak Management Team. Goed gewogen. Wat dat precies gaat zijn dat besluit, daar gaat u misschien vragen over stellen – dat respecteer ik – maar ik ga er niet op vooruit lopen. Nu willen we eerst precies bekijken wat de analyse is die de virologen en de epidemiologen maken van de situatie op dit moment en op basis daarvan dan zondag daarover praten en dan richting besluitvorming op dinsdag.
topics_EN: Literal Text Press Conference after Council of Ministers January 8, 2021
speeches_EN: Yes, all good day. And I don't know if it is still allowed, the best wishes, I think I am a day late, but still very sincere I also look forward to our collaboration in the new year and I hope that it is a good year for you, both professional and in terms of health, especially. Few points on my part for introduction. To start with, I want to say something about the situation in the United States. We have of course seen the images of the storming of the Capitol in Washington. Of course a lot has been said about it, there was a lot of criticism of what we have all been able to follow live. I think it is extremely important that parliamentarians can always do their work independently and independently. And so this should not have happened. Fortunately, the democratic process in the US appears to be unstoppable and both the election results and thus also confirm the victory of Joe Biden and thus officially determined. We all look forward to the inauguration on January 20 of the new president. Also the collaboration. The Netherlands and the United States are close-knit allies and certainly also with the departure of the United Kingdom from the European Union, I believe that a special role as perhaps the most transatlantic country of that European Union, without the United Kingdom, and therefore also a special role in collaboration with America: the country that liberated us in the Second World War with others. Then today after the two earlier meetings at the Catshuis, the first time that we have really discussed the findings of the Van Dam committee about the allowances, the childcare allowance. We spoke about that before, just before the Christmas recess. The terrible facts, the shame, that encourages us all when reading the report of that parliamentary committee of inquiry. We are now looking at the most important substantive question: namely how can we ensure that something like this can no longer happen in the future? But of course we also talk about the questions raised where the rule of law, information provision. All of this requires an extremely clear answer from the cabinet. That comes as soon as possible, we have to do carefully. We are working on that cabinet response and if necessary we will discuss this again next week. Then briefly something about vaccination. That started this week in the Netherlands. That is of course a happy moment. Every Dutchman who is protected against the virus is a step forward. Developments in the field of vaccinations follow each other in a lint pace. And today of course the good news about the extra order that has been placed and has been promised by Pfizer and of course the hopefully rapid approval of the Astra-Zenseca vaccine. But that does not mean, I would like to say that we are relieved of the virus from one day to the next. It really takes some time. It is very important for people that they naturally have the vaccine, but for the country as a whole it really takes a while before we also notice it collectively. Unfortunately you see here, but also in other countries, in Germany it is now rising to record figures. In England, but also in the Netherlands. No record figures, but too high infection figures. It also remains busy, too busy, in the hospitals and in the intensive care departments. While it is important, not so much that we want to relieve care - that care is not waiting for less work at all - that care only wants to be able to work for the people who also come to the hospital in addition to Corona, because they are dealing with serious complaints, for example cancer or heart surgery and do not want to postpone those operations. That is why it is so important that we can lower Corona's pressure on health care. Then we also have to deal with the British variant, of which also in the countries around us that this has also been introduced there. That does not make the image quieter either. So for the time being, in the coming period, no matter how hard we work on vaccination, too few vaccinated people to help us get out of trouble in this way. So it remains very important that we all comply with the coronar rules very well. And that also applies if you are vaccinated. And of course there is light at the end of the tunnel, let's determine that together. The good news is that we now have perspective, later this year, that we may finally be rid of that misery. Nevertheless: the figures still high. That means that the Outbreak Management Team will also advise us in the coming days about what they think we should do. We will also talk about that on Sunday in the Catshuis in the well -known composition and then on Tuesday in the ministerial committee. That means that there is also a press conference again next Tuesday. And how we continue after January 19. Again, that will be a well -considered decision based on the advice of the Outbreak Management Team. Well weighed. What that goes exactly is that decision, you might ask questions about that - I respect that - but I am not going to improve. Now we first want to look at exactly what the analysis is that virologists and epidemiologists at the moment and on that basis are talking about it on Sunday and then towards decision -making on Tuesday.

topics_nl: Letterlijke tekst persconferentie na ministerraad 18 december 2020
speeches_nl: Ja, goedemiddag allemaal en laat ik nog kort stilstaan, ik heb dat gisteren gedaan ten overstaan van een aantal media al buiten Algemene Zaken, toch iets te zeggen over het indrukwekkende rapport van de parlementaire ondervragingscommissie kinderopvangtoeslag. Ik wil herhalen wat ik gister zei. Het is een heftig rapport, het is een belangrijk rapport. Ik vind het ook een fair rapport. Ik denk dat Chris van Dam en de commissie hebben geprobeerd om zo goed mogelijk de puzzel te leggen. Het beeld te schetsen. Waarbij het beeld heel helder blijft liggen, dat onschuldige mensen hier in de knel zijn gekomen. En daar kunnen we ons alleen maar voor schamen. De rechtsstaat moet de burger beschermen tegen de almacht van de Staat, en dat is hier heel erg mis gegaan. Er ligt een belangrijke opdracht nu van deze commissie en daar moeten wij als kabinet mee aan het werk. Namelijk: hoe zorgen we ervoor dat dit in de toekomst niet meer kan gebeuren. Hoe zorgen we voor de compensatie voor de ouders? We zullen daar tijd voor nemen, niet in de lengte, maar in de diepte. We proberen natuurlijk zo snel mogelijk met een kabinetsreactie te komen. We gaan daar wel veel uren in steken, maar wel in een korte tijd proberen we dat te doen. We beginnen daarmee ook al voor de kerst aanstaande week in het Catshuis een sessie met een heel aantal collega’s en dan willen we in januari komen met een kabinetsreactie. Nogmaals, het belangrijkste is nu dat de ouders zo snel mogelijk worden geholpen. Dan was vandaag ook de laatste ministerraad van 2020, en ook dat is geen vrolijk verhaal. 2020 is een jaar waarin de wereld er totaal anders uit zag en we vinden het inmiddels normaal zoals u hier zit en ik hier sta met die mondkapjes en alles, maar het is natuurlijk allemaal toch tamelijk bizar en niemand had zich dat kunnen voorstellen aan het begin van het jaar. De precieze gevolgen van de coronacrisis verschillen per persoon, maar opgeteld was 2020 voor heel Nederland een zwaar jaar. En op persoonlijk niveau voor eigenlijk iedereen ingrijpend en heel anders dan alle andere jaren. De pandemie, en ook de maatregelen daartegen, die duren natuurlijk al lang. Het is inmiddels al weer zo’n 9 maanden. En het is voor iedereen natuurlijk moeilijk om dan de motivatie er ook in te houden en om je aan alle regels te houden. En ik merk wel dat echt veruit de meeste Nederland enorm hun best doen, maar tegelijkertijd, ja weet je, is er altijd het risico dat het virus toch een keer geluk heeft en overspringt en dat gebeurt in een te groot aantal gevallen. En daarom is het zo belangrijk dat we hebben moeten besluiten tot die lockdown van afgelopen dinsdag en ook voor de scholen afgelopen woensdag. Tegelijkertijd zie je ook als je terugkijkt op dit jaar dat in de samenleving natuurlijk ontzettend mooie initiatieven ontstaan. Mensen staan voor elkaar op, willen elkaar helpen, heel veel vrijwilligers werk. En dat is wat in ieder geval voor mij persoonlijk Nederland ook tot zo’n mooi land maakt, dat we wat mopperend, uiteindelijk er voor elkaar staan, elkaar niet in de steek laten, elkaar niet laten vallen. En die veerkracht die is enorm en dat geeft ook vertrouwen, gelukkig, voor onze economie en daarmee voor banen en bedrijven die het heel zwaar hebben op dit moment, maar tegelijkertijd toch ook het vooruitzicht dat we hier een keer uit gaan komen en dat de verwachting is dat ook veel ondernemers het zwaar hebben maar uiteindelijk ook heel veel ondernemers de kans zullen krijgen en ook zullen grijpen om toch daarna weer het bedrijf op te bouwen en daarmee ook die banen zoveel mogelijk te behouden. En dat komt ook omdat we diepe zakken hebben. We hebben een hele grote appel voor de dorst en daar zijn we nu flinke happen uit aan het nemen, maar die appel maakt het wel mogelijk om dit te doen. Dan tot slot 2021. Ook dan nog steeds het virus voorlopig, maar wel meer perspectief. Het vaccin, het testen, daarnaast natuurlijk ook toch geleidelijk aan, hopen wij, meer doorbraken op het gebied van medicijnen. Dat gaat niet in een reuzesprong, maar geleidelijk aan komen we dichterbij aan het einde van de tunnel. Daar mogen we op vertrouwen. Daarna komt de fase van herstel. We zitten dan op het punt weer van maart dit jaar. We weten ook dat het land van maart dit jaar, als we daar weer zijn, ook niet foutloos was. Er moesten nog heel veel dingen gebeuren en dat zal nog steeds zo moeten, op heel veel terreinen. Maar op het moment dat we daar weer over kunnen nadenken zitten we wel op een punt dat we in ieder geval de coronapandemie in dit land een stuk achter ons hebben gelaten. Maar nog steeds liggen er grote vragen rondom stikstof, rondom klimaat, de woningmarkt en natuurlijk, het speelt vandaag hevig, de gevolgen van Brexit en hoe die onderhandelingen aflopen. Dat zal ook van betekenis zijn in 2021. En natuurlijk verkiezingen in maart, en kijken hoe die aflopen en wat dat betekent voor de politieke richting die het land inslaat. Nu eerst de feestdagen. Dat betekent niet dat de strijd tegen corona stilligt. Allereerst omdat helaas het land op slot zit tot in eind januari minimaal. Dus we voeren ook die strijd tijdens de Kerst en Oudjaar met elkaar samen. We blijven ook als kabinet daarbij in touw. Volgende week vergadert de ministeriele commissie die er over gaat nog een keer regulier. De meest betrokken ministers komen in de week voor oud en nieuw samen, fysiek, en zullen daarnaast heel veel telefonisch overleg hebben. Die zijn allemaal ingepland. Zodat we ook direct kunnen overgaan tot actie als dat nodig is. Maar ik hoop voor dit moment wel dat heel Nederland ondanks de omstandigheden zo goed mogelijke kerstdagen heeft, heel anders dan andere jaren, maar toch even kan reflecteren op 2020. Hopelijk in te kleine kring toch ook even kan stilstaan bij wat ons is overkomen, ook wat we dit jaar hebben teruggevonden aan samenhang, aan eenheid in dit land. En vooruit kan kijken naar volgend jaar. En ik wens iedereen natuurlijk voor 2021 en nader hopelijk fijne kerstdagen, gezondheid, en dat wij met elkaar in 2021 dit vreselijke gegeven van corona achter ons kunnen laten.
topics_EN: Literal Text Press Conference after Council of Ministers December 18, 2020
speeches_EN: Yes, good afternoon everyone and let me stand still for a short time, I did that yesterday before a number of media already outside of general affairs, to say something about the impressive report of the parliamentary interrogation committee for childcare allowance. I want to repeat what I said yesterday. It is a fierce report, it is an important report. I also think it's a fair report. I think Chris van Dam and the committee have tried to lay the puzzle as well as possible. To sketch the image. The image remains very clear, that innocent people have fallen here. And we can only be ashamed of that. The rule of law must protect the citizen against the omnipotence of the state, and that went very wrong here. There is now an important assignment from this committee and we as a cabinet have to work with it. Namely: how do we ensure that this can no longer happen in the future. How do we take care of the compensation for the parents? We will take time for that, not in length, but in the depth. Of course we try to come up with a cabinet reaction as quickly as possible. We will spend a lot of hours in it, but we try to do that in a short time. We also start a session with a large number of colleagues before Christmas next week in the Catshuis and then we want to come up with a cabinet reaction in January. Again, the most important thing is that the parents are helped as quickly as possible. Then today was also the last Council of Ministers of 2020, and that is not a cheerful story. 2020 is a year in which the world looked completely different and we now think it is normal as you sit here and I stand here with those mouth caps and everything, but of course it is all rather bizarre and nobody could have imagined that at the beginning of the year. The precise consequences of the coronac crisis differ per person, but 2020 was a tough year for the whole of the Netherlands. And on a personal level for actually everyone radical and very different from all other years. The pandemic, and also the measures against it, that of course have long been. It has been around 9 months now. And of course it is difficult for everyone to keep the motivation in it and to stick to all the rules. And I do notice that by far most of the Netherlands is doing their best, but at the same time, yes you know, there is always the risk that the virus will be lucky and will spread and that happens in too large a number of cases. And that is why it is so important that we had to decide on that Lockdown last Tuesday and also for the schools last Wednesday. At the same time you also see when you look back on this year that of course incredibly beautiful initiatives arise in society. People stand for each other, want to help each other, a lot of volunteers work. And that is what at least makes the Netherlands such a beautiful country for me personally, that we are a bit grumbling, ultimately there, not leting each other down, not dropping each other. And that resilience that is huge and that also gives trust, luckily, for our economy and therefore for jobs and companies that are having a hard time at the moment, but at the same time also the prospect that we will come out of this once and that the expectation Is that many entrepreneurs also have a hard time, but in the end a lot of entrepreneurs will get the chance and will also seize and afterwards to rebuild the company and with it to retain those jobs as much as possible. And that is also because we have deep pockets. We have a very big apple for the thirst and we are now taking big bites, but that apple makes it possible to do this. Then finally 2021. Even then the virus for the time being, but more perspective. The vaccine, testing, in addition of course also gradually, we hope, more breakthroughs in the field of medicines. That is not in a giant jump, but gradually we get closer to the end of the tunnel. We can trust that. Then comes the recovery phase. We are then about to have March again this year. We also know that the country of March this year, when we are there again, was also not flawless. A lot of things still had to happen and it will still have to be done in many areas. But the moment we can think about that again, we are at a point that we have at least left the Coronapandemie in this country a bit behind us. But there are still large questions about nitrogen, around climate, the housing market and of course, it plays heavily today, the consequences of Brexit and how those negotiations end. That will also be significant in 2021. And of course elections in March, and see how they end and what that means for the political direction that the country takes. Now first the holidays. That does not mean that the fight against Corona is still. First of all, because unfortunately the country is locked until the end of January at least. So we also compete with each other during Christmas and New Year's Eve. As a cabinet, we also continue to rope. Next week, the ministerial committee that is about it will meet again. The most involved ministers come together for New Year's Eve in the week, physically, and will also have a lot of telephone consultations. They are all scheduled. So that we can also take action immediately if necessary. But for the moment I hope that despite the circumstances have the best possible Christmas, the whole of the Netherlands, very different from other years, but can still reflect on 2020. Hopefully in too small a circle can also consider what happened to us, also What we have found this year to coherence, to unity in this country. And you can look ahead to next year. And of course I wish everyone before 2021 and hopefully Happy Christmas, Health, and that together in 2021 we can leave this terrible fact from Corona behind us.

topics_nl: Letterlijke tekst persconferentie na ministerraad 11 december 2020
speeches_nl: Goedemiddag, en voordat ik echt begin wil ik ook hier mijn respect betuigen aan collega Hugo de Jonge. Hij heeft gister een moeilijk besluit genomen. Hij heeft eigenlijk het partijbelang en ook zijn persoonlijke belang ondergeschikt gemaakt aan het landsbelang. Aan zijn grote verantwoordelijk nu die hij heeft als minister die verantwoordelijk is voor de coronabestrijding, het handelen van deze crisis en ik wil daar mijn grote waardering voor uitspreken. Dat hebben wij ook in de ministerraad gedaan vandaag. We hebben in de ministerraad uiteraard gesproken over de voortgaande strijd tegen het coronavirus. Dinsdag hebben de minister-president en minister De Jonge u al bijgepraat. En sindsdien is de situatie niet verbeterd. Eigenlijk zijn de cijfers slecht. Vandaag weer nog iets meer besmettingen dan gister. Het aantal opnames in ziekenhuizen en op ic’s is gewoon te hoog. En daarmee is de druk op de medisch specialisten, op het verplegend personeel en al die anderen die zo hard voor ons werken, is gewoon te hoog. Dus die besmettingscijfers moeten omlaag en daarvoor zijn we eigenlijk allemaal, alle Nederlanders, aan zet. Ik wil echt mensen oproepen: help mee. Want het is aan ons om ruimte te creëren, ruimte voor de mensen in de zorg, maar ook ruimte voor onszelf om straks ook te kunnen versoepelen. Dus hou je aan de regels. Ook nu, misschien wel juist nu de kerstdagen naderen. Er start ook nog een campagne die daarop gericht is, op die kerstperiode, om ons allemaal eraan te herinneren dat we, ook in deze tijd, die drukte moeten blijven vermijden en afstand van elkaar moeten houden. Rekening moeten houden met de coronaregels, hoe moeilijk dat soms ook is. Bij die handhaving van de regels in de publieke ruimte daar spelen mede-overheden, waaronder gemeenten, een hele belangrijke rol. En ik wil ook hier mijn waardering  voor die mensen, en ik denk in het bijzonder ook aan burgemeesters, ik noem bijvoorbeeld Urk en Roosendaal. Moeilijke situaties en dus een moeilijke taak voor burgemeesters, maar zij doen dat goed. Ze gaan het gesprek aan, ze tonen begrip voor de moeilijke situatie waar mensen in zitten, maar ze treden ook op waar het nodig is. Dus waardering daarvoor. De minister-president is in Brussel voor de Europese Raad. Daar is gisteren al een akkoord bereikt over het rechtsstaatmechanisme, waarmee een directe koppeling wordt gelegd tussen de besteding van Europees geld en belangrijke principes als de rechterlijke onafhankelijkheid en vrije pers. En er is ook een reeks andere onderwerpen aan bod geweest, maar de minister-president licht de pers ter plekke in Brussel hierover in. Tot slot, bij wijze van inleiding, wil ik hier ook mijn waardering uitspreken de AIVD. Zij hebben een grote spionageoperatie in Nederland beëindigd. Het onderzoek van de dienst heeft ertoe geleid dat twee Russische diplomaten tot persona non grata zijn verklaard en Nederland zullen moeten verlaten. We zijn er daardoor denk ik ook weer aan herinnerd dat Nederland op het gebied van innovatie en technologie, wetenschap, tot de top van de wereld behoort.  Dat maakt ons ook aantrekkelijk voor  spionage. Dat onderstreept de noodzaak voor alle organisaties en bedrijven om daar heel alert op te zijn, en het onderstreept ook het belang van onze veiligheidsdiensten. Dank u wel.
topics_EN: Literal Text Press Conference after Council of Ministers December 11, 2020
speeches_EN: Good afternoon, and before I really start I want to express my respect here to colleague Hugo de Jonge. He made a difficult decision yesterday. He has actually made the party interest and also his personal interest subordinate to the national interest. To his great responsibility that he has as a minister who is responsible for the Corona Bidding, the actions of this crisis and I want to express my great appreciation for that. We also did that in the Council of Ministers today. In the Council of Ministers, of course, we spoke about the ongoing fight against the Coronavirus. On Tuesday, the Prime Minister and Minister De Jonge already talked to you. And since then the situation has not improved. The numbers are actually bad. Today a little more infections than yesterday. The number of recordings in hospitals and in ICs is simply too high. And with that the pressure on the medical specialists, on the nursing staff and all those others who work so hard for us, is simply too high. So those infection figures have to be reduced and for that we are all, all Dutch people. I really want to call people: help. Because it is up to us to create space, space for the people in healthcare, but also room for ourselves to be able to relax. So stick to the rules. Even now, perhaps just now that Christmas is approaching. There is also a campaign that is focused on it, on that Christmas period, to remind us that we should continue to avoid that crowds and keep it away from each other. Having to take the coronar rules into account, no matter how difficult that is sometimes. In the enforcement of the rules in the public space there, co-governments, including municipalities, play a very important role. And here too I want my appreciation for those people, and I also think of mayors, for example, I mention Urk and Roosendaal. Difficult situations and therefore a difficult task for mayors, but they do that well. They start the conversation, they show understanding for the difficult situation in which people are, but they also occur where it is needed. So appreciation for that. The Prime Minister is for the European Council in Brussels. There yesterday an agreement has already been reached on the rule of law, which makes a direct link between the use of European money and important principles such as judicial independence and free press. And there has also been a series of other topics, but the Prime Minister informs the press on the spot in Brussels. Finally, as an introduction, I also want to express my appreciation here the AIVD. They have ended a major espionage operation in the Netherlands. The service investigation has led to two Russian diplomats being declared persona non grata and will have to leave the Netherlands. As a result, I am also reminded that the Netherlands is in the field of innovation and technology, science, the top of the world. That also makes us attractive for espionage. This underlines the need for all organizations and companies to be very alert, and it also underlines the importance of our security services. Thank you.

topics_nl: Letterlijke tekst persconferentie minister-president Rutte en minister De Jonge (8 december 2020)
speeches_nl: Goedenavond. Al een paar weken geleden zag je de eerste kerstbomen in huiskamers, zag je lichtjes in tuinen en kerstversieringen in het straatbeeld en nu, meteen na Sinterklaas, draaien de kerstboomverkopers overuren. Het laat zien hoe extra belangrijk Kerst dit jaar voor ons is. Het is een zwaar jaar voor heel veel mensen, een jaar van verlies en rouw en dat geldt zeker voor al die families die dit jaar iemand aan corona hebben verloren. Inmiddels tellen we door corona bijna 10.000 lege stoelen aan de kersttafel. Dat is natuurlijk ongelooflijk verdrietig en een extra reden waarom we met Kerst zo graag bij elkaar willen zijn. Het is niet voor niets een van de meest gestelde vragen van de laatste weken: wat kunnen we met de Kerst? Het antwoord is: helaas niet meer dan de laatste maanden. Dus per dag maximaal drie gasten vanaf dertien jaar thuis ontvangen en niet naar een restaurant. En ook verder blijft de gedeeltelijke lockdown gelden. Dat is een hard gelag, want we hadden het zo graag anders gewild: voor onszelf, voor de horeca, voor andere sectoren. En we hadden natuurlijk gewoon ook op meer gehoopt. Bij de persconferentie drie weken geleden leek het reëel dat er rond half december weer iets meer zou kunnen, bijvoorbeeld dat de restaurants weer open zouden gaan, dat we thuis weer meer mensen zouden kunnen ontvangen of dat we weer met het voetbalteam zouden kunnen trainen. Maar het gaat echt niet goed: niet met de besmettingscijfers en niet in de ziekenhuizen. We hoopten half december op ongeveer tien intensivecareopnames per dag te zitten, dat is het niveau waarop we voorzichtig weer wat meer zouden kunnen. Maar we zitten nu op meer dan het dubbele en de realiteit van vandaag is dat we op een tweesprong staan. Óf we zorgen er samen voor, door ons gedrag, dat de cijfers toch weer de goede kant op gaan. In dat geval zou het kunnen dat we – half januari – wel op die tien IC-opnames per dag komen. Óf de cijfers blijven stijgen en dan sluit ik zelfs niet uit dat we voor de Kerst bij u terug moeten komen met nog strengere maatregelen. Dat wil natuurlijk niemand, maar we mogen daar ook niet voor weglopen als dat nodig zou zijn. Mijn oproep is dus: laat ons de kerstperiode goed benutten door zo veel mogelijk thuis te blijven en ons ook verder aan de regels te houden. Het gaat echt om de bekende en de voor de hand liggende dingen. Dus niet denken bij een kriebelhoest ‘het is vast een verkoudheidje, dat gaat wel over’. Nee: blijf thuis, laat je testen en ga in quarantaine en als de test positief is, dan blijven ook je huisgenoten thuis. En als je dan gedwongen thuis zit, aarzel niet hulp te vragen voor de dagelijkse boodschappen of de hond uit te laten. Vraag ook hulp als je het even niet ziet zitten. Houd altijd en overal afstand, ook met een mondkapje op. Doe je kerstboodschappen alleen. En natuurlijk: was je handen stuk als je ergens binnenkomt, ook bij familie en vrienden. Laten we er zo met elkaar voor zorgen dat we inderdaad half januari weer iets meer ruimte krijgen. Dat kan nog steeds, maar die vrijheid kunnen we alleen met elkaar verdienen. En als dat moment komt, willen we natuurlijk zo goed mogelijk voorbereid zijn. Want hoe geef je mensen dan maximaal ruimte en krijgt het virus toch geen kans om opnieuw toe te slaan? Dat is een vraag waar bijvoorbeeld iedereen in de cultuur-, in de sport- en in de evenementensector heel druk mee bezig is. In januari gaan we een paar strak gecontroleerde proefprojecten doen om te kijken wat er allemaal nodig is om straks verantwoord weer op te starten. Gewoon uitproberen in de praktijk dus, los van hoe de cijfers zich ontwikkelen. Dat doen we lokaal en heel gecontroleerd, want we willen natuurlijk niet dat het virus hierdoor extra kansen krijgt. En waar moet u dan aan denken? Bijvoorbeeld aan een proef met een theatervoorstelling met meer publiek of bijvoorbeeld aan een proef met een lokale voetbalwedstrijd met grotere groepen supporters in het stadion. Wat vraagt dat van de organisatie en inrichting? Hoe moeten mensen lopen, zitten, staan? Kan met testen meer? Dus wat is er in de praktijk wel en niet haalbaar en verantwoord? Tot slot van mijn kant nog drie punten. Ten eerste dat we kijken naar extra steun voor bedrijven die het het zwaarst hebben, bijvoorbeeld de restaurants en cafés. Juist in de horeca wordt veel pijn geleden. Morgen geven Wouter Koolmees, Eric Wiebes en Wopke Hoekstra een persconferentie over de verdere aanpak van de steunpakketten. En sowieso is het een goed idee uw kerstdiner af te halen bij of te laten bezorgen door uw favoriete restaurant. Ten tweede: omdat we ons realiseren dat jonge mensen een zware tijd hebben, komt er voor hen een plan met extra geld voor speciale activiteiten. Dat doen we samen met de gemeenten en vooral samen met de jongeren zelf. Denk aan een theatervoorstelling of een film maken. Ander voorbeeld: in de kerstvakantie zullen de  Krajicek Foundation en de Cruyff Foundation wintergames organiseren. Verder is het nu nog zo dat jongeren tot achttien jaar in teamverband kunnen trainen bij hun sportclubs. We gaan het OMT vragen of we dat in de loop van januari op kunnen rekken naar zevenentwintig jaar. Ten derde en als laatste: het is logisch dat de coronavermoeidheid na negen maanden toeneemt. Dat voelen we allemaal, maar één groep in het bijzonder en dat zijn natuurlijk al die mensen in de ziekenhuizen, verpleeghuizen, in de thuiszorg. De drukte en hoogspanning van dit jaar stapelt op, het werk wordt zwaarder en het wordt steeds lastiger de roosters rond te krijgen, zeker met de Kerst. Alleen al om die reden moeten we elkaar blijven helpen hier doorheen te komen, om de mensen die het het zwaarst hebben qua belasting wat lucht te gunnen. En om daarna verder te kunnen kijken naar de fase waarin we het virus er hopelijk onder gaan krijgen. Daarover nu meer van Hugo de Jonge.
topics_EN: Literal text Press conference Prime Minister Rutte and Minister De Jonge (December 8, 2020)
speeches_EN: Good evening. A few weeks ago you saw the first Christmas trees in living rooms, you saw lights in gardens and Christmas decorations in the streets and now, immediately after Sinterklaas, the Christmas tree vendors run overtime. It shows how extra important Christmas is for us this year. It is a tough year for a lot of people, a year of loss and mourning and that certainly applies to all those families who have lost someone to Corona this year. In the meantime we count almost 10,000 empty chairs at the Christmas table through Corona. That is of course incredibly sad and an extra reason why we want to be together at Christmas.
